TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ObjectListCommandCollection extends System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ArrayListCollectionBase implements class System.Web.UI.IStateManager

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The class object provides the container for the commands of an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList>. Accessing the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.Commands%2A> property of an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> retrieves an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection> object. An application can programmatically add or remove commands.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection> class implements the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface through the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ArrayListCollectionBase> class.
## Examples For a complete example, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> overview.

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

Docs.param: The command to add to the end of the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds a command to the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AddAt(int32 index, class System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommand command) cil managed

Docs.param: The location in the collection at which to add command.
The to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds a command at the location in the collection specified by the index parameter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A value of -1 for the `index` parameter specifies that the command is added to the end of the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Clears the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is not available in the read-only <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IObjectListFieldCollection> interface.
You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection.Clear%2A> method for all the classes where this method applies. For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection.Clear%2A> method for a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> collection clears all the styles in the collection. For the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoiceCollection>, it clears all the choices in the collection.
Adding a field to the fields of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control, and requires you to bind data to the control again.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 IndexOf(string s) cil managed

Docs.param: A string to search for in the collection.
Docs.summary: Returns the index of the command whose name is the specified string. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: The index of the command whose name is the specified string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Returns the index of the command whose <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommand.Name%2A> property is the string specified by the s parameter. If matching items are not found in the collection, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection.IndexOf%2A> method returns -1.
